targeted_wrong_answers: The Attorney General has the authority to refer any question of law of public interest without the permission of the Court of Appeal.
The Supreme Court holds the power to refer any question of law of public interest without the permission of the Court of Appeal.
The Public Prosecutor may refer any question of law of public interest to the Court of Appeal without prior permission from the Supreme Court.
